head.supplied: Chief Secretary's Office ¶ Melbourne, 26 Septr 1884 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ With reference to your letter of the 20th instant ¶ and previous correspondence ¶ in regard to the necessity for the publication of a B...

div.p: From Thomas Wilson to Stanley Dobson
No. 3505, p. 884, unit 68, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

With reference to your letter of the 20th instant
See S. Dobson to J. Service, 20 September 1884 (in this edition as M84-09-20). and previous correspondence
See S. Dobson to J. Service, 12 September 1884 (in this edition as M84-09-12), and S. Dobson to G. Berry, 20 September 1884 (in this edition as M84-09-20a). The following letters, all at A84/8354, unit 59, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria, are also relevant: S. Dobson to G. Berry, 13 September 1884. S. Dobson to E. Thomas, 17 September 1884, and S. Dobson to J. Service, 19 September 1884. in regard to the necessity for the publication of a Botanical Key I have now the honor to inform you that the Chief Secretary has approved of the desired Key being published and has issued instructions to the Government Printer accordingly.
See also T. Wilson to M, 26 September 1884, and S. Dobson to T. Wilson, 27 September 1884 (in this edition as M84-09-27).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
